title: BitJannik
author: BitJannik
content: Some blockchain projects claim to be more decentralized than BTC.Do they succeed in this regard or do they face similar challenges?What lessons could BTC learn from these projects, if any?

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: BitJannik on November 29, 2024, 11:31:21 AMSome blockchain projects claim to be more decentralized than BTC.There isn`t any project which is more decentralized than btc. Also, there isn`t any that claims to be so.What are you talking about? Any project in your mind?

comments.author: Churchillvv
comments.body: I haven't seen any article that says what, what, what coin is more decentralised than bitcoin, only coin that I recognise is monero which is only privacy focus and not more decentralised than bitcoin. So what coin or project do you think is to be compared with bitcoin decentralised system? you have to let us know maybe we haven't heard of it or we are lazy to know about it. what  think

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: BitJannik on November 29, 2024, 11:31:21 AMSome blockchain projects claim to be more decentralized than BTC.Do they succeed in this regard or do they face similar challenges?What lessons could BTC learn from these projects, if any?Those claims doesn't have any facts and are false. Compare to number of nodes, bitcoin has the highest in numbers and is in PoW in concept compare to PoS which most new tokens are now in use. They should learn more on bitcoin instead.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Decentralisation is achieved through multiple layers but I just want to mention something common that anyone can understand why Bitcoin is being the most decentralised blockchain than any others.The nodes are responsible for the validation of the blocks and Bitcoin network has the most number of nodes that makes it as highly decentralised on the validation level than any other. People debate that mining pools are controlled by few pools that pose 51% attack on the network which raise concern about decentralisation but in reality miners act at the interest of network even when they had over the required to do such attack.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: I don't know if a Blockchain can really claim such Because most Blockchains can only brag about beating Bitcoin in scalabilty. If they can have a bigger community and nodes than Bitcoin then they can claim such. Bitcoin has nothing to learn Why should an Original imitate a copy.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: You need to be specific and name the cryptocurrency that has made the claim so that we can first analyze that claim to see if it is true (which is unlikely because the existing altcoins I've seen have more traces of centralization than bitcoin has) and then analyze how it was achieved to "learn from it".

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: From your previous posts it seems that you are interested in Kaspa. Decentralization has not become a profitable criterion so many coins and tokens being launched no longer care about such classifications and may prefer to be centralized to avoid regulatory restrictions or problems with the government.

comments.author: Iranus
comments.body: If Saotshi can create bitcoin then it is no surprise that someone can create a better project than bitcoin because technology never stops evolving and geniuses always appear. But as far as I know, there is no project like you said so far, bitcoin is still considered the most decentralized and best project when it comes to blockchain or cryptocurrency field. Like many other investors, I also regularly follow market news but I don't see any projects claiming that they are more decentralized than bitcoin or better than bitcoin. At least you should tell us which project you are referring to instead of being so vague.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: I am yet to see another blockchain project that is "more" decentralized than bitcoin. On the surface people may claim or make it appear like that but in reality such projects dont exist yet.Hence when someone comes to you with this type of a claim, you are most likely dealing with a scam. If you see someone peddling one on their own, dont encourage them or this community here will not let them sleep with their accusations in future.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: Quote from: BitJannik on November 29, 2024, 11:31:21 AMSome blockchain projects claim to be more decentralized than BTC.Do they succeed in this regard or do they face similar challenges?What lessons could BTC learn from these projects, if any?No project is more decentralized than bitcoin and if there is any claiming to be so, just know that they’re just blabbering and looking for attention which in some time, they won’t be relevant again. Since the inception of bitcoin, many cryptocurrencies have tried to compare themselves with bitcoin and always want to have an edge over them but all proves abortive and bitcoin continues to stand undefeated and untouchable when it comes to decentralization as a whole. So don’t waste your time on these projects that are showcasing and trying to compare themselves with bitcoin, they are just waste of time in my opinion and should be avoided.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: BitJannik on November 29, 2024, 11:31:21 AMSome blockchain projects claim to be more decentralized than BTC.Do they succeed in this regard or do they face similar challenges?What lessons could BTC learn from these projects, if any?What do you mean by "decentralization" Name one project that claim this and i guarantee that, those projects haven't got any real stress tests, or serious attacks in levels of bitcoin.Yes, one could argue that huge mining farms could bring down decentralization and there could be ways to combat this, or that when majority of that mining is controlled by specific country, it's a bad thing. But when BTC doesn't have a company that regulators could attack to, it's isn't centralized around it either, unlike some altcoins, or even worse, altcoins with private source code.

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: Is this a joke or what? Other crypto projects can't even maintain decentralisation for long and you are here talking about how they are more decentralised than Bitcoin? There is none, I have no hate for other crypto projects and I have invested heavily on other coins too, but I know how neat Bitcoin decentralisation is, since i have been into crypto world there is nothing that comes even close to Bitcoin, it is different from every other blockchain projects ever created.

comments.author: Swordsoffreedom
comments.created_time: November 30, 2024, 01:31:18 PMLast edit: November 30, 2024, 02:18:53 PM by Swordsoffreedom
comments.body: Even though I am a bitcoin investor and I like bitcoin a lot, but unlike many others, I even hope it happens. Because our world is constantly evolving and it would be great if we had a better currency than bitcoin to serve us. But I don't think we'll see that anytime soon, I don't think there's going to be any currency that can beat bitcoin at least in this decade. Looking at what is going on, millions of altcoin projects have been created but most of them are just focused on profit, pump and dump...without any use case. How can it be decentralized or will it be better than bitcoin? I bet that's what you think, no project dares to claim that.
